comments:
Build 20020528

I can see what happenned, but i do not know how to reproduce the problem. There 
must have been (at least) two different VM install types, both of which at some 
point detected a default VM install (assigning an ID of 0). Then, one of the 
installs went missing, and we re-detected a VM install of the other type, with 
the same Id.

Can put a fix in the code.

I zipped up my workspace. Let me know if you want it (or part of it, since it 
is more than 100MB big)

For now, keep your workspace. When I believe I have a patch I will send it to 
you to try it out.

Please verify code (I will send patch to Jerome for testing). See 
JavaRuntime.detectVMConfiguration().
Verified code.  Jerome, if the patch works for you, please set status to verified.
